cr.title: Veteran Voting Support Act
cr.excerpt: Mr. Speaker, I have no further speakers, and I yield back the balance of my time.

cr.title: Electing Officers of The House of Representatives
cr.excerpt: I thank the gentleman for yielding. Mr. Speaker, I rise today actually for two reasons, to congratulate Mrs. Miller, rightfully so. She was selected, rightfully so, that the Speaker was able to appoint her. But today I actually rise in disappointment, disappointed in this resolution. As the Member said, I am a new Member from California....

cr.title: Iraq War Resolution
cr.excerpt: Madam Speaker, I thank the gentlelady for yielding and for her service to the country. Madam Speaker, I rise today in a different position than the majority of this body. You see, I am one of the 54 newly elected Members of this Congress. We did not have the opportunity to debate and vote on the authority to use military force in Iraq....

cr.title: Buck Owens Post Office
cr.topics: Buck Owens Post Office: SECTION 1. BUCK OWENS POST OFFICE.
cr.excerpt: Mr. Speaker, I rise today in strong support of H.R. 1384, a bill I introduced to designate the United States Postal Service facility located at 118 Minner Avenue in Bakersfield, California as the "Buck Owens Post Office." An accomplished, self-taught musician, Alvis Edgar "Buck" Owens, Jr. amassed twenty-one country music hits throughout...

cr.title: Campaign Expenditure Transparency Act
cr.topics: Campaign Expenditure Transparency Act: PARLIAMENTARY INQUIRY

cr.title: Recognizing the 60th Anniversary of The United States Air Force As an Independent Military Service
cr.excerpt: Mr. Speaker, I rise today in strong support of H. Con. Res. 207, a resolution recognizing the 60th anniversary of the United States Air Force as an independent military service. cr.title: A Quarterly Report Card

cr.title: Committee Funding Resolution
cr.excerpt: Mr. Speaker, I thank the gentleman for yielding, and I appreciate the work that he has done. Mr. Speaker, I rise today to reluctantly oppose this. cr.title: Republican Freshmen Third Quarterly Report to The 110th Congress
cr.excerpt: I thank the Congressman from Illinois, Mr. PETER ROSKAM, and all those who have joined with us tonight.

cr.title: Fourth Quarterly Report of The Freshmen Republicans
cr.excerpt: Well, I thank the gentleman, and I thank all the freshmen that have been able to join us tonight, because really tonight was about bringing accountability and maybe some adult supervision because I think that's what the American public wants to see here in Congress, see that we are able to provide more free time, not take up more of your time...

cr.title: Larry S. Pierce Post Office
